about.name: Edinburgh
about.info_text: Edinburgh is the capital city of Scotland, known for its rich history, stunning architecture, and vibrant arts scene. It is a city of contrasts, where medieval and modern elements coexist harmoniously. From the historic and imposing Edinburgh Castle that dominates the skyline to the lively and artistic streets of the Old Town and New Town, Edinburgh offers a unique blend of culture, natural beauty, and tradition. The city is famous for its annual festivals, including the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, which is the world's largest arts festival.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 540,000
Country: Scotland, United Kingdom
Time Zone: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT)
Language: English, Scots, and Scottish Gaelic
Currency: British Pound (GBP)
about.climate_text: Edinburgh experiences a maritime climate with mild summers and cool winters. Rainfall is spread throughout the year, so it's advisable to carry an umbrella or raincoat when exploring the city.

attractions_card.title: Edinburgh Castle
attractions_card.description: Edinburgh Castle is a historic fortress perched on Castle Rock and offers panoramic views of the city. It's one of Scotland's most iconic landmarks.

attractions_card.title: Royal Mile
attractions_card.description: The Royal Mile is the main street of the Old Town, lined with charming shops, restaurants, and historic sites, including the Palace of Holyroodhouse and St. Giles' Cathedral.

attractions_card.title: Arthur's Seat
attractions_card.description: Arthur's Seat is an ancient extinct volcano located in Holyrood Park, providing excellent hiking opportunities and breathtaking views of the city.

attractions_card.title: The Scotch Whisky Experience
attractions_card.description: Discover the art of whisky-making in Scotland at The Scotch Whisky Experience and enjoy guided tours and tastings of this iconic beverage.

attractions_card.title: National Museum of Scotland
attractions_card.description: The National Museum houses an extensive collection of artifacts, including science, technology, fashion, and Scotland's history.

attractions_card.title: Calton Hill
attractions_card.description: Calton Hill offers a unique perspective of the city's skyline and features various neoclassical monuments, including the National Monument and the Nelson Monument.

attractions_card.title: Edinburgh Festival Fringe
attractions_card.description: The Edinburgh Festival Fringe is the world's largest arts festival, featuring thousands of performances, from comedy to theater, throughout the city every August.

attractions_card.title: Holyrood Palace
attractions_card.description: The Palace of Holyroodhouse is the official residence of the British monarch in Scotland and offers guided tours of its historic chambers.

food_card.title: Haggis
food_card.description: Haggis is a traditional Scottish dish made from minced sheep's heart, liver, and lungs, mixed with oats and spices, typically served with neeps and tatties (turnips and mashed potatoes).

food_card.title: Scottish Salmon
food_card.description: Enjoy delicious Scottish salmon, often prepared with a variety of seasonings and accompaniments, offering a taste of Scotland's pristine waters.

food_card.title: Cullen Skink
food_card.description: Cullen skink is a hearty Scottish soup made with smoked haddock, potatoes, onions, and cream, creating a comforting and flavorful dish.

food_card.title: Scotch Pie
food_card.description: Scotch pies are savory pastries filled with minced meat, often served hot and enjoyed as a snack or light meal in Scotland.

food_card.title: Shortbread
food_card.description: Indulge in traditional Scottish shortbread cookies, known for their buttery, crumbly texture and sweet flavor.

hotels_card.title: The Balmoral
hotels_card.description: The Balmoral is a luxurious and iconic hotel located in the heart of the city, offering elegant accommodations and world-class service.

hotels_card.title: The Witchery by the Castle
hotels_card.description: The Witchery is a unique and opulent hotel near the Royal Mile, known for its romantic and Gothic-inspired rooms and gourmet dining.

hotels_card.alt: Radisson Collection Hotel, Royal Mile Edinburgh
hotels_card.title: Radisson Collection Hotel, Royal Mile Edinburgh
hotels_card.description: This stylish hotel is located on the historic Royal Mile, offering modern comfort and easy access to many of the city's attractions.

hotels_card.title: The Scotsman Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Scotsman Hotel is a boutique hotel with a rich history, combining traditional charm with modern amenities, and it's just a short walk from the train station.

transport_card.title: Edinburgh Trams
transport_card.description: The Edinburgh Trams provide a convenient and eco-friendly way to travel within the city, connecting the airport, city center, and other key locations.

transport_card.title: Lothian Buses
transport_card.description: Lothian Buses offer an extensive bus network serving Edinburgh and its suburbs, making it easy to explore the city and its surroundings.

transport_card.title: Edinburgh Waverley Railway Station
transport_card.description: Edinburgh Waverley is the city's main railway station, providing excellent rail connections to other cities in the UK, including Glasgow and London.

transport_card.title: Edinburgh Airport
transport_card.description: Edinburgh Airport (EDI) is the primary international gateway to the city, serving a range of domestic and international destinations.
